title: Curriculum Design and Reform Simulation Using Semiotic Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Principles of higher education curriculum design and expertise in social sciences
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented educational environment for working professionals, utilizing a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) technological infrastructure

learning_goals: Using semiotic analysis tools, it is possible to identify and map the symbolic code systems of existing curricula.
Applying a creative approach that reinterprets disciplinary boundaries, a plan for restructuring the curriculum can be proposed.
In a simulation environment, practical curriculum improvement plans can be developed using VR-based collaborative tools.
Systematic justifications for curriculum changes can be logically explained from a semiotic perspective.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
